instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the related study on the automatic recognition of THz pulsed signals of breast IDC?

instruction: What metric was chosen to distinguish different tissues in the related study on the automatic recognition of THz pulsed signals of breast IDC and how far can this metric go in terms of accuracy?
Output:
The metric chosen to distinguish different tissues in the study is the energy to Shannon entropy ratio (ESER). This metric, which is a novel index proposed by the researchers, is used to analyze the complexity of the transmission terahertz (THz) signal from breast tissue samples. 

In terms of accuracy, the study reports that the areas under the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curves for the three adopted classifiers are all larger than 0.89. This indicates a relatively high level of accuracy in distinguishing different breast tissues using the ESER index. Additionally, the best breast invasive ductal carcinoma (IDC) recognition performance achieved in the study is reported to have a precision of 92.85%, sensitivity of 89.66%, and specificity of 96.67%. These results suggest that the ESER index, in combination with the machine learning classifier, can effectively identify different breast tissues with a high level of accuracy.
